detailed.question: According to the system detailed for revivifying bone-black, how is bone-black dried and what is the subsequent processing it undergoes within the furnace?
detailed.ground_truth: After being washed, the bone-black is first passed through an automatic drier—ingeniously formed by undulating pipes at the upper part of the furnace—where waste heat and combustion gases help drive off moisture through a series of steam vents. Once thoroughly dried, the bone-black descends into the furnace itself, where it undergoes revivification within cast-iron retorts, carefully heated and protected by refractory clay blocks to ensure even processing and prevent burning.
